reviews.body: Thanks for the review and the proposed changes!

comments.body:
I generally agree. However, in this case I'd advocate for using either the name or the identifier since they're pretty much the same.

On a slightly different note, having an "identifier" maybe isn't great in the first place, since it's easily confused with a field name of a struct.
The event is detected by Alice the client and can be communicated to Alice the user. I'll clarify.
Again, if they're exactly the same I don't think it makes much of a difference. In the case of the "identity link wapper key" we haven't even defined an identifier to use.
